message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.NA, cs.SY, cs.SP 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper deals with the problem of estimating DOAs of signals impinging on an antenna array, even when a few elements of the array fail to work. This problem is related to information theory, as it involves the recovery of missing information from incomplete data. 
2. cs.SI (Signal Processing): The paper proposes a new technique to estimate DOAs using a combination of matrix completion and matrix pencil methods. Both these methods are commonly used in signal processing applications. 
3. cs.NA (Numerical Analysis): The paper involves the use of numerical techniques such as matrix completion and matrix pencil methods to estimate DOAs. 
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control): The problem of estimating DOAs in the presence of faulty antenna elements can be seen as a control problem, where the goal is to maintain the performance of the system despite the presence of faults. 
5. cs.SP (Speech Processing): Although the paper does not explicitly mention speech processing, the proposed technique can be applied to speech signals as well, as they can be modeled as signals impinging on an antenna array.
